attributes.action: ensure the maximum reasonable amount of content produced by Downing Street is licensed through Creative Commons or other similar permissive licences
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently material (such as photographs) produced by Number Ten and hosted on sites such as Flickr is posted with "all rights reserved" meaning that there is little than citizens can do (lawfully) to use the material themselves on websites or other sources.
The Creative Commons licences allow consumers to make creative use of the material posted to the internet while preserving the copyright and other rights of the content creators. The range of licences available also have a range of permissive rights, so ensuring that content creators can ensure their work is used in a suitable way.
There seems to be little reason why citizens, who pay for the creation of the content through their taxes, should not be allowed to make use of it in their own publications.

rejection.details: Comments about the Downing Street website should be sent to webmaster@pmo.gov.uk
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
